FuncDef:
The reserved ip-address command configures the reservation type of an IP address for a user, either leased-based IP address reservation or MAC-address-based IP address reservation.
The undo reserved ip-address command cancels the previous configuration.
By default, IP addresses are not reserved. When a user goes offline, the IP address is reclaimed.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable the user to use the originally-allocated IP address for the second login, which is called IP address reservation, you can run the reserved ip-address command to configure the reservation type.
If a user is assigned a lease of four days during the first login, the user can still use the originally-allocated IP address provided that he goes online for the second time within four days. This is called lease-based IP address reservation.
If a user's MAC address and the allocated IP address are recorded during the first login, the user can still use the originally-allocated IP address when he goes online for the second time. This is called MAC-address-based IP address reservation.
Configuration Impact
If MAC-address-based IP address reservation is used, the state of the address entry is reserved after a user gets offline; if leased-based IP address reservation is used, the state of the address entry is used after the user gets offline.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
This command supports only IPoE users.
